snippet: A Democrat elected to the State Senate from an Orthodox Jewish pocket of Brooklyn drew little voter criticism after saying he would probably caucus with Republicans.
abstract: Democrat Simcha Felder, elected to New York State Senate from an Orthodox Jewish pocket of Brooklyn, draws little voter criticism after saying he would probably caucus with Republicans; Felder's move could help Republicans retain control of a closely divided Senate.
lead_paragraph: A Democrat elected to the State Senate from an Orthodox Jewish pocket of Brooklyn drew little voter criticism after saying he would probably caucus with Republicans.

headline.seo: Simcha Felder’s Change in Party Leanings Is No Surprise to Constituents
headline.main: Change in Party Leaning Is No Surprise to Constituents
headline.print_headline: Change in Party Leaning Is No Surprise to Constituents
